title: Do supports get cs or not
body: I've  never really been sure so I've always been on the safe side and only farmed when my adc or other team mates can't so when is the right time if ever to farm as a sup ?

replies.body: Long as no other team mates are around and you couldn't be using your time more efficiently i.e: Warding, De-warding, Roaming, Assisting team mates.

When there is nobody there to take the cs and just you sitting next to the turret with no enemy pressure, no allies around you and no emergencies going on the map, I say why the hell not take some money before going somewhere else.

Supports can farm, as long as you're not farming alongside someone who is not exactly overflowing with gold and exp then it's tbh okay to take some. But ofc don't get too into it and ending up forgetting your team.
To add to this, if it's a case of your ADC backed and your holding lane, try to freeze the lane while you get the CS.

To add more, if your adc is too busy playing badminton with the enemy adc to lasthit, or has a bad timing with lasthit, feel free to get whatever he's missing.
It's free.

There is a common misconception that you shouldn't give support kills or CS. The reality is that gold anywhere on your team is going to be beneficial. It's probably more beneficial to your ADC for sure, But as long as you're not denying your ADC huge amounts i have no issue with it. In fact, Gold is probably going to be more useful on your support until about the 20 minute mark.

How is gold more useful on the support till the 20 minute mark?

I'm curious to hear some bullshit.

Till 20 maybe not, but till 10-15, definitely yes.
A support that can tank his way trough the fight and repeatedly stun whoever gets closer is arguably more useful than, say, an infinity edge on a blood splat.
Ever saw a fed Leona? Not fun.
if you can last hit about 80% of the wave its probably worth it, otherwise you should and could be warding or protecting your pushing/jungling teammates from ganks
Thank you guys you gave me much clearer understanding <3
